properties.title: Java date and time API - Upgrade from 0.99 to 1.0
properties.author: Stephen Colebourne

section.name: Upgrade
section.p:
These are the release notes and advice for upgrading Joda-Time from version 0.99 to version 1.0.
Joda-Time version 1.0 ---------------------
Joda-Time is a date and time handling library that seeks to replace the JDK Date and Calendar classes.
This is the first full release of Joda-Time. There have been numerous beta releases over an extended period of time.
We recommend JDK 1.3 or later, and have performed no testing on earlier JDKs.
Joda-Time is licensed under the business-friendly Apache License Version 2. This is the same license as all of Apache, plus other open source projects such as Spring. The intent is to make the code available to the Java community with the minimum of restrictions. If the license cause you problems please contact the mailing list.
Incompatible changes since 0.99 ------------------------------- Deprecated methods removed. See https://www.joda.org/joda-time/upgradeto099.html for 0.98 to 0.99 changes
